intro: Polyspora luzonica, commonly known as the Luzon star moss, is a species of liverwort found in the Philippines. It belongs to the family Porellaceae and is characterized by its dense, star-like arrangement of leaf-like structures. The plant typically grows on damp, shaded rocks or soil in montane forests. It has a low-growing, mat-forming habit with small, green thallus that is rich in chlorophyll. Polyspora luzonica plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its native ecosystem.
